result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason D Klug was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $3,215.00. Remaining to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

BAIL APPLIED. Blood draw costs PAID. Will be forwarded to City of Waukesha Police Dept.
DNA PAID IN FULL.

AS OF 9/15/2015: Remove DNA-bail that was applied will be applied to the balance of the fine.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance to the Victim Impact Panel meeting while on Extended Supervision.

Defendatn IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 42 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (taverns, bars, liquor stores)
Not to operate without a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided if in custody otherwise within 3 business days at the Waukesha Sheriff's dept.

superTimeConds.notes: To be done during Extended Supervsion.

Court to Address:  Competency Evalution Prepared by Dr. Niess (Evaluation finds the defendant is competent to proceed).

State and Defense have received a copy of the competency evaluation.
Neither the State or Defense are contesting the findings of Dr. Niess or requesting an additional evaluation.
Court Finds the Defendant is Competent to Proceed with his Revocation Proceedings.
filed by Dr. Jenna Niess

Order for Competency Examination By Department of Health Services.

Review hearing on November 13, 2020 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Jason D Klug in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Marie Ostrowski, by zoom.

Defense has no objections to the request for a competency evaluation.
Court will order a competency evaluation under 971.14 - on an out patient in custody basis.
Court will appoint the WI Forensic Unit to conduct the evaluation.
Competency Evaluation Due on:  11/02/2020  Review hearing scheduled for November 13, 2020 at 08:45 am.  Check Case scheduled for November 2, 2020.

records.addlTxt: Filed by the Defendant requesting the Court waive the DNA sample.

Filed by the Defendant requesting a copy of his judgment of conviction.
Copy of JOC sent to Defendant on 9/10/15.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed filed by Defense Counsel.

Defendant Jason D Klug in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. 


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 5 years 8 months (Initial Confinement: 32 months, Extended Supervision: 3 years) -  42 days credit
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting while on Extended Supervision
- Alcohol Assessment
- Fine totaling $3801.00 - apply bail - balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department - to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision - append to fine
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a condition of extended Supervision - append to fine
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns or liquor stores). Not operate a motor vehicle without a valid DL.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided ,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 - Defendant to perform 150 hours of community service as a Condition of Extended Supervision
Sentencing memorandum letter filed by Badger State Investigative Services.
Sentencing hearing on August 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Jason D Klug in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed by operation of law. Defense advises they are having a private Presentence prepared and request another date for sentencing. Court grants request. Defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. Court orders bail revoked. Defense to provide the Court and DA's office a copy of his presentence report before the next hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Dated July 23, 2015 filed by Attorney Kulkoski advising Court defendant will be entering plea at the 7/30/15 date but will be requesting a different sentencing date due to completion of private PSI.

Court will give a date in 30 days.  Defense to advise on the next date if this matter will be set for a plea or trial. Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
